intro: Tontelea emarginata, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Tontelea emarginata is known for its nocturnal blooming habit and its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
